Add darkmode / nightmode to your Nuxt project in a few seconds
🌓 Add darkmode / nightmode to your Nuxt.js project in a few seconds
Automatically shows Darkmode if the OS preferred theme is dark
Can be used programmatically without widget (Darkmode instance accessible from Vue)
Can be installed as a Nuxt Module
Check out the demo in these websites:
yarn add nuxtjs-darkmode-js-module # or npm install nuxtjs-darkmode-js-module
If you don't want to show the widget and enable/disable Darkmode programatically you can use the method
. You can also check if the Dark Mode is activated with the method
. See them in action in the following example:
// in a vue instance check example in example/pages/index.vue
// this will work well only if `disableWidget: true` in the options
// caution the following method is not reactive
is added to the body tag when the darkmode is activated. You can take advantage of it to override the style and have a custom style
where you don't want to apply darkmode
You can also add this style:
in your CSS, this will also ignore the darkmode.
It is also possible to revert the Dark Mode with this style
If it does not work you may have to add the following code, but this will invalidate the classes to override.

to provide the Dark Mode.
It may not be compatible with all the browsers. Therefore the widget has been hidden in Internet Explorer and Edge.
This library also uses
to automatically enable the Dark Mode if the OS prefered theme is dark.
Contributions, issues and feature requests are welcome!

html .light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html.light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
